subject: Re: [junit] Ann: "Test-Driven Development: A Practical Guide"
msgSnippet: I second this recommendation.  It provides a very solid background for TDD and only incidentally uses Java and JUnit as an implementation example.
messageBody:
I second this recommendation. It provides a very solid background for
TDD and only incidentally uses Java and JUnit as an implementation
example.

On Thursday, July 10, 2003, at 03:02 PM, Johannes Link wrote:

>> If you're looking for a book specifically on TDD you should certainly
>> pick Dave's or Kent's.
>
> Or "Unit Testing in Java - How Tests Drive the Code"
> (http://www.amazon.com/exec/obidos/ASIN/1558608680).
>
> There's a companion website offering TOC, forewords, preface and a
> sample
> chapter for download as well as all sources:
> www.mkp.com/companions/1558608680
>
> Johannes
>
